headline: It Was the Ideal Antique Building. Who Needs Bathrooms, Anyway?
caption: To create the main living space, they removed pews and added a suspended Fireorb fireplace. The Harvey Probber sectional sofa is vintage, the white lounge chairs are Eames Aluminum Group from Herman Miller (from $1,985) and the wall is decorated with framed tea towels by the artist David Shrigley ($45 each).
openai_alt_text_refined: A spacious living area features a suspended Fireorb fireplace, vintage Harvey Probber sofa, Eames lounge chairs, and framed tea towels by David Shrigley.

headline: The Making of 'Six': How Tudor Queens Turned Into Pop Stars
caption: The cast of “Six” on Broadway: From left are Anna Uzele as Catherine Parr; Brittney Mack as Anna of Cleves; Adrianna Hicks as Catherine of Aragon; Abby Mueller as Jane Seymour; Andrea Macasaet as Anne Boleyn and Samantha Pauly as Katherine Howard.
openai_alt_text_refined: The cast of "Six" poses in colorful costumes against a shiny backdrop, featuring Anna Uzele, Brittney Mack, Adrianna Hicks, Abby Mueller, Andrea Macasaet, and Samantha Pauly.

headline: Warren Kanders Quits Whitney Board After Tear Gas Protests
caption: Protesters in May demanding that Warren B. Kanders be removed from the board of the Whitney Museum of American Art. He resigned on Thursday.
openai_alt_text_refined: Protesters hold signs demanding Warren Kanders' removal from the Whitney Museum board, with banners reading "Dismantle Patriarchy" and "No Space for Profiteers."

headline: A History of Race and Racism in America, in 24 Chapters
caption: Clockwise, from top left: Phillis Wheatley, Harriet Beecher Stowe, Alice Walker, Michelle Alexander, Margaret Mitchell, Edgar Rice Burroughs and Thomas Jefferson.
openai_alt_text_refined: Collage featuring portraits of Phillis Wheatley, Harriet Beecher Stowe, Alice Walker, Michelle Alexander, Margaret Mitchell, Edgar Rice Burroughs, and Thomas Jefferson.

headline: A Reckoning for College Fraternities and Sororities
caption: Portraits of these students at Vanderbilt University were taken over Zoom. Organizers asked to be photographed as a group of equals, instead of individuals, to recognize their solidarity. From left, Daniel S. Wrocherinsky, Riya Patel, Rachel Rosenberg, Nicole Gillis, Simi Odugbesan, Lucy Barse, May Donahue
openai_alt_text_refined: Portraits of Vanderbilt University students taken via Zoom, featuring Daniel S. Wrocherinsky, Riya Patel, Rachel Rosenberg, Nicole Gillis, Simi Odugbesan, Lucy Barse, and May Donahue.

headline: Where 'Block Party' Has a Score of Meanings
caption: An installation view of Lizania Cruz’s “We the News,” 2018, at Jenkins Johnson Projects in Brooklyn.
openai_alt_text_refined: Colorful wall installation featuring images and text on immigration themes, including "Immigrants Are... So Am I," with various photographs and posters.
